Schedule12.OR: Maintains a queue of all system-wide alarms and provides APIs to manage alarms
System Starter, launches ROM-based servers that need to be started at device boot, depending on start-up mode.
Schedule12.CS: Assorted basic utilities available to frameworks, services, and applications. System utilities (BAFL) including resource file interface and clipboard, system sounds, command-line parsing, descriptor arrays, resource file handling. Used by higher level frameworks and services and available directly to applications.
Schedule12.OS: Smart messaging framework and support. In the System Model this is Bio Messaging Framework and Bio Messaging Parsers.
Bluetooth connection and service manager and Bluetooth protocol stack. System Model names are Bluetooth Manager, Bluetooth SDP and Bluetooth Stack PRT.
Schedule12.OR: Board Support Packages. For EKA2 this is the Variants for Lubbock, OMAP H2 and OMAP H4, the Bootstrap, the Emulator Variant, Peripheral Bus Controllers and reference PDDs. Board Support Packages also includes the Power Domain Manager, Text Window Server and User HAL.
Framework for supporting content rendering plug-ins. This includes Content Handling Framework and the SMIL Rich Media Parser.
C standard library for Symbian OS
Schedule12.OS: Engine implementation for calendar application. This is called Agenda Model in the System Model.
CDMA SMS PRT and CDMA SMS Plugins and CDMA WAP PRT
Schedule12.CR: OMA CP 1.1 compliant protocol implementation. Supports provisioning via WAP Push, Email, OBEX, Removable Media and the SIM.
Schedule12.CS: Central setting database
Schedule12.OR: Certificate and key management framework and APIs
Character set converters. This includes the Character Encoding Conversion Framework and the Character Encoding Conversion Plug-ins.
Supplies provisioning of network access points, WAP proxies, MMS, OMA DS and OMA DM accounts, POP, IMAP and SMTP email accounts and browser bookmarks.
Schedule12.CS: Networking and communications configuration information
Schedule12.OR: File logging engine used by comms framework and available to other components.
Schedule12.CS: Framework and utilities to support communications protocols and servers including Comms Root Server, Comms Framework, Network Interface Manager and MBuf Manager.
Schedule12.CR: Comms Server CSY plugin providing serial port emulation over IR, USB, Bluetooth and a virtual serial port.
Schedule12.OR: Network connection agents and agent plug-in interface providing connection to circuit-switched and packet-switched networks. Includes CSD AGT, PSD AGT and Network Controller.
Device side connectivity framework. This includes low level Device Connection Component, Service Framework and Service Providers.
Redistributable PC side connection manager for use by licensees of partners creating host side connectivity suites.
Schedule12.OS: Engine implementation for contacts application. This is called Contacts Model in the System Model.

OS.name: Content Access Framework v2 for DRM

Schedule12.OS: Framework that enables DRM style content management. Note that this is the CAFv2 framework.
Framework supporting secure cryptographic tokens (e.g. smart cards)
Symmetric and asymmetric keys, hash algorithms, and pseudorandom number generators. Note this is export restricted
Schedule12.OR: Protocols utilities and interfaces for OSI Data Link Layer level protocols. This includes a Link Layer Control group of components: Ethernet Services, Ethernet NIF and Ethernet Packet Driver, Wireless LAN, PPP NIF and PPP Compression Plug-ins
Mime Recogniser Framework plugins for URLs and bookmarks. This includes Web Recognisers.
Schedule12.OS: Relational database APIs and implementation. This is DBMS in the System Model.
Schedule12.CR: Drivers supporting hardware devices. This includes Ethernet Driver, USB Driver, Audio Driver, Speech Driver, Video Driver, MIDI Driver, SD Card***, SDIO*** and Other LDDs.
CLDC is the J2ME configuration typically used for smaller devices. Symbian's CLDC implementation uses an optimised port of Sun's CLDC HI 1.1.1s DAC Virtual Machine
Schedule12.OS: Telephony API extensions for packet based services.
Schedule12.OR: Fax client and server side API's and protocol stack
Schedule12.CS: Error resolving framework used by multiple components
Error mapping data used by Error Resolver
Telephony server and client side APIs which includes ETel Server/Core, ETel Multimode, ETel Packet Data and Etel SIM Toolkit
Telephony APIs for 3rd party applications
Schedule12.OR: Specific geographic localisation information providing localisation framework and locale specific strings. System Model name is Locale Support.
Schedule12.CS: API which allows applications to query the presence of optional features.
Schedule12.OR: This is File Converter Framework, File Converter Plug-ins and Chinese Calendar Converter
Schedule12.CS: Generic file-system server and client-side APIs.
Schedule12.CR: Filesystem plug-in implementations for specific filesystems. This is called File Systems in the System Model.
Schedule12.OR: Generic support for code and data storage on Large, Small and OneNand NAND Flash using Unistore2 software.

CS.name: Font and Bitmap Server and Font Store

Schedule12.CS: Font and Bitmap Server and supporting APIs
Schedule12.OR: Free Type vector font rasterizer. System Model name is FreeType Font Rasterizer.
Schedule12.CS: Provides Graphics services and includes Graphics Device Interface (GDI), Colour Palette (PALETTE), Bitmapped Graphic Device Interfaces (BITGDI), Window Server (WSERV).
Schedule12.OS: Messaging plug-in supporting SMS for GSM send, receive, and edit. This includes the SMS MTM and Scheduled Send MTM components.
Schedule12.CS: Short message service stack for GSM products only and includes SMS PRT, SMS Utilities, GSM Utilities and WAP PRT components.
Schedule12.OR: Provides grid handling suitable for spreadsheet tables.
Transport framework supporting HTTP protocol
Schedule12.OS: Engine implementation for context sensitive help application.
Schedule12.CS: Plug-in framework for software image conversion codecs.
Schedule12.OS: Messaging plug-in modules supporting send, receive and edit internet mail protocols including POP3, IMAP and SMTP.
Schedule12.OR: Utility classes that support standard internet protocols. This includes HTTP Protocol Plug-in, HTTP Filter Plug-ins and HTTP Utilities Library
Schedule12.OS: PRT plugin to ESock Sockets Server, implements IrDA infrared stack.
Schedule12.OR: Java extensions for mobile media and called Mobile Media API 1.1 in the System Model.
Java extensions for 3D graphics and called Mobile 3D 1.0 in the System Model.
Provides standard Java APIs to allow Java-enabled devices to integrate into a Bluetooth environment. Note: excludes optional Obex package. This is called Bluetooth 1.0 in the System Model.
Provides common Java platform. Includes MIDP2.0 (JSR118), Wireless messaging (JSR120), and Multimedia (JSR135) - optional
Schedule12.CR: Provides the basic application environment: UI, storage, basic audio and graphics. This includes MIDP 2.0 Profile (Device Control, LCD UI, RMS, MIDlet Lifecycle, I/O).
Schedule12.OR: Provides standard access to wireless communication resources to allow 3rd party developers to build intelligent connected applications. This is called WMA1.1 in the System Model.
Schedule12.OS: Provides a reference implementation for the untrusted security domain as defined in JSR185 JTWI. This is called Security Policy in the System Model.
Schedule12.CS: OS Kernel for low level device start-up.
Schedule12.OR: Location based services framework and reference plugins
Log engine for use by applications called Event Logger in the System Model.
Low level plug-ins to the MDF interfacing to device drivers.
Reference software image conversion codecs. This is included in the Image Conversion Library.
Schedule12.OS: Framework and support for email and phone messaging. This includes Message Store and Scheduled Send MTM.
Schedule12.OR: A tuner control for analogue and/or digital broadcast channel reception.
Reference audio controller plug-in. This is included in Multimedia Framework Plug-ins.
Reference sound device implementation. This is included in Multimedia Framework Plug-ins.
This is called Camera in the System Model .
placeholder - contains OpenMAX, and is badly named.

CS.name: Multimedia Framework and Media Device Framework

Schedule12.CS: This subsystem comprises a high level framework for manipulating standard media formats and a low level framework for managing media devices of various kinds. This includes Multimedia Framework, MMF Recogniser, Media Device Framework. Media device drivers can be found in the Device Driver component.
Schedule12.OR: Messaging module implementing MMS support and called MMS MTM in the System Model.
Application models for word, sheet and data. In the System Model this is Word Engine, Sheet Engine and the Data Engine.
Schedule12.OS: OBEX protocol implementation supporting IrDA, Bluetooth, and USB. This includes OBEX Protocol .
Schedule12.OR: OBEX MTM supporting OBEX over Bluetooth and Infrared.
Schedule12.OS: Defines APIs for Open GL ES
Schedule12.OR: Restricted redistribution PC side connectivity components including SCOM. This is not shown in the System Model.
PIM optional component provides access to Contacts and Agenda, FileGCF provides restricted access to the file system
SIM card phone book synchronisation server and client side APIs
Schedule12.OS: Plug-in server framework and client-side APIs.
Schedule12.OR: Framework for print job setup and control.
Driver library supporting specific printer families and includes some printer drivers.

Protocols, utilities and interfaces for Quality of service at the Physical layer and above. As defined in CDMA, UMTS and IETF standards. This includes two QOS Interface components (QOS interface and UMTS QOS extension) and two PRTs (QOS Framework PRT and GPRS UMTS PRT)
Real Time Transfer Protocol and Real Time Control Protocol
Schedule12.CR: Device dependent interface to bitmaps and screen device, not a device driver.
Schedule12.CS: C32 Server (for devices with serial comms including IrDA) and serial comms APIs
Schedule12.OR: OSI session level Internet protocols utilities and interfaces. This includes FTP Engine and Telnet Engine.
Framework for SIP (Session Initiation Protocol)
Schedule12.CS: Sockets API and control logic for networking. This is called ESock Server in the System Model.
Schedule12.OS: Secure software install for Java MIDlet, JAR, and Symbian SIS file formats. This includes 3 components: App Installer, SIS Installer and Java MIDlet Installer
Schedule12.OR: Secure software install for Java MIDlet, JAR, and Symbian SIS file formats. This is not shown in the System Model.
Schedule12.CR: Persistent data storage and data streaming model for applications with supporting APIs.
Schedule12.OR: SyncML implementation supporting data sync. This includes Sync Initiation, SyncML Framework, Data Sync Plugins.
Implementation of OMA Device Management v1.2. This includes Device Management Framework component and Plugins.
Global device status monitor
SQL database functionality for Symbian internal and external applications.
Server providing scheduled application launch
Schedule12.CS: Internet Transport and Network level protocols, utilities and interfaces. Includes IP Hook, Internet Sockets, TCP/IP v4/v6 PRT and DND. Includes IP event notifier.
Schedule12.OR: Internet Transport and Network level protocols utilities and interfaces. Includes IP Sec and VPN.
This is DHCP.
Schedule12.CS: Transport layer security delivering SSL 3.0 and TLS 1.0 protocols over IPv4/v6.
Schedule12.CR: Telephony server plugin to integrate Symbian OS with baseband providing support for GPRS and UMTS. This component includes the TSY together with implementations of a connection initiation agent (AGT), a network interface module (NIF) and a multiplexing Serial Comms Server (CSY).
Schedule12.OR: APIs for manipulating telephone numbers called Dial in System Model.
Schedule12.OS: Text Formatting and Layout Services.
Schedule12.OR: Support for rendering text in the Devanagari script.
Schedule12.OS: Rich Text Storage and Handling.
Schedule12.OR: Timezone conversion between UTC and Wallclock time. Includes timezone database and compiler.
UI frameworks support for graphical animations
Schedule12.CS: UI Plug-in Frameworks which includes UI App Framework (Uikon, UI Look and Feel, Control Environment and FEP Base), App Architecture, Mime Recogniser Framework, UI Graphics Utilities.
Schedule12.OS: USB Class support providing control for USB device. This is called USB Manager in the System Model.
Schedule12.CS: User Libraries used by all user-side code and by the kernel, providing fundamental basic services.
Schedule12.OR: Electronic business card and electronic schedule parser (vCard 2.1 and vCalendar 1.0)
Direct navigational links (DNL) framework enables applications to switch into or use views of other applications.
WAP message interface to 3rd party stacks
Support for WAP push. This includes the WAP Push Framework, WAP Push MTM and WAP Push Handler.
Part implementation of a WAP stack that supports the messaging functionality.
Animation plug-ins to window server. This is called Clock and BMP Animation in the System Model.
Country and city information database
Provides an XML Parsing Framework with a SAX like API and parser plug-ins for XML and WBXML. This includes XML Framework, XML Parser and WBXML Parser. These have been mapped to Store in the past.
Schedule12.OS: ZIP compression / decompression Library. This is called ZIP Compression Library in the System Model.

TEST.name: CDMA TSY, Multimode TSY and SIM TSY
Font and printer file conversion utilities (GDTRAN)
Tools
TEST.more: (excluding non commercial Tools as listed in Schedule 7)

Schedule12.footnote: * Denotes Java components originating from Sun Microsystems (which are subject to Sun's legal terms).
** Denotes Java JSRs, subject to the requirements of TCK testing
*** Note that use is subject to licensee's obtaining the relevant licence(s) from SD-3C LLC and/or 4C Entity LLC
